metadata.description: Preview data for ANCHOR mental health app

journalEntries.title: Weekend Recovery
journalEntries.body: Today I woke up feeling more optimistic than usual. I've been practicing the breathing exercises from my therapist and they really seem to help with my morning anxiety. I'm grateful for having tools to manage my mental health.

journalEntries.title: Celebrating Small Wins
journalEntries.body: Practiced mindfulness meditation for 15 minutes this morning. It's becoming easier to observe my thoughts without judgment. This practice is really helping me stay centered throughout the day.

journalEntries.title: Progress Check-in
journalEntries.body: Had some cravings today but I used my coping strategies. Called a friend, went for a walk, and reminded myself of my goals. The craving passed and I feel stronger for having worked through it.

journalEntries.title: Anxiety Management
journalEntries.body: Practiced mindfulness meditation for 15 minutes this morning. It's becoming easier to observe my thoughts without judgment. This practice is really helping me stay centered throughout the day.

journalEntries.title: Therapy Homework
journalEntries.body: Feeling anxious about an upcoming presentation at work. Instead of catastrophizing, I'm trying to focus on what I can control: preparation, self-care, and using my coping skills.

journalEntries.title: Feeling Grateful Today
journalEntries.body: Feeling anxious about an upcoming presentation at work. Instead of catastrophizing, I'm trying to focus on what I can control: preparation, self-care, and using my coping skills.

journalEntries.title: Mindfulness Practice
journalEntries.body: Had some cravings today but I used my coping strategies. Called a friend, went for a walk, and reminded myself of my goals. The craving passed and I feel stronger for having worked through it.

journalEntries.title: Celebrating Small Wins
journalEntries.body: Therapy session went well today. We talked about identifying triggers and developing healthier response patterns. I'm learning that recovery is a process, not a destination.

journalEntries.title: Meditation Session
journalEntries.body: Reflecting on my journey so far. There have been ups and downs, but overall I can see how much I've grown. I'm becoming the person I want to be, one day at a time.

journalEntries.title: Celebrating Small Wins
journalEntries.body: Had a really challenging day at work today. My manager was being particularly demanding and I felt overwhelmed. But instead of reaching for unhealthy coping mechanisms, I took a 10-minute walk and did some deep breathing. Small victories count.

journalEntries.title: Anxiety Management
journalEntries.body: Working on forgiveness - both for others and for myself. It's one of the hardest parts of recovery, but I know it's essential for my healing and growth.

journalEntries.title: Therapy Homework
journalEntries.body: Had a really challenging day at work today. My manager was being particularly demanding and I felt overwhelmed. But instead of reaching for unhealthy coping mechanisms, I took a 10-minute walk and did some deep breathing. Small victories count.

journalEntries.title: Difficult Conversation
journalEntries.body: Working on forgiveness - both for others and for myself. It's one of the hardest parts of recovery, but I know it's essential for my healing and growth.

journalEntries.title: Meeting with Therapist
journalEntries.body: Spent quality time with my family today. It reminded me why I'm working so hard on my recovery. My kids deserve the best version of me, and I'm committed to being present for them.

journalEntries.title: Meeting with Therapist
journalEntries.body: Had some cravings today but I used my coping strategies. Called a friend, went for a walk, and reminded myself of my goals. The craving passed and I feel stronger for having worked through it.
